edu.stanford.nlp.trees

Class CoordinationTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.trees.CoordinationTransformer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TreeTransformer

    public class CoordinationTransformer
extends java.lang.Object
implements TreeTransformer
    Coordination transformer transforms a PennTreebank tree containing a coordination in a flat structure in order to get the dependencies right.
    The transformer goes through several steps:
    • Removes empty nodes and simplifies many tags (DependencyTreeTransformer)
    • Relabels UCP phrases to either ADVP or NP depending on their content
    • Turn flat CC structures into structures with an intervening node
    • Add extra structure to QP phrases - combine "well over", unflattened structures with CC (QPTreeTransformer)
    • Flatten SQ structures to get the verb as the head
    • Rearrange structures that appear to be dates
    • Flatten X over only X structures
    • Turn some fixed conjunction phrases into CONJP, such as "and yet", etc
    • Attach RB such as "not" to the next phrase to get the RB headed by the phrase it modifies
    • Turn SBAR to PP if parsed as SBAR in phrases such as "The day after the airline was planning ..."
    • Rearrange "now that" into an SBAR phrase if it was misparsed as ADVP
    • (Only for universal dependencies) Extracts multi-word expressions and attaches all nodes to a new MWE constituent
    Author:
    Marie-Catherine de Marneffe, John Bauer, Sebastian Schuster

      static Tree UCPtransform(Tree t)
      Transforms t if it contains an UCP, it will change the UCP tag into the phrasal tag of the first word of the UCP (UCP (JJ electronic) (, ,) (NN computer) (CC and) (NN building)) will become (ADJP (JJ electronic) (, ,) (NN computer) (CC and) (NN building))

      • transformTree

        public Tree transformTree(Tree t)
        Transforms t if it contains a coordination in a flat structure (CCtransform) and transforms UCP (UCPtransform).

        transformTree in interface TreeTransformer

        Returns:
        t transformed

      • SQflatten

        public Tree SQflatten(Tree t)
        Removes the SQ structure under a WHNP question, such as "Who am I to judge?". We do this so that it is easier to pick out the head and then easier to connect that head to all of the other words in the question in this situation. In the specific case of making the copula head, we don't do this so that the existing headfinder code can easily find the "am" or other copula verb.

      • removeXOverX

        public static Tree removeXOverX(Tree t)

      • UCPtransform

        public static Tree UCPtransform(Tree t)
        Transforms t if it contains an UCP, it will change the UCP tag into the phrasal tag of the first word of the UCP (UCP (JJ electronic) (, ,) (NN computer) (CC and) (NN building)) will become (ADJP (JJ electronic) (, ,) (NN computer) (CC and) (NN building))
        Parameters:
        t - a tree to be transformed
        Returns:
        t transformed

        Transforms t if it contains a coordination in a flat structure
        Parameters:
        t - a tree to be transformed
        Returns:
        t transformed (give t not null, return will not be null)

      • MWETransform

        public static Tree MWETransform(Tree t)
        Puts all multi-word expressions below a single constituent labeled "MWE". Patterns for multi-word expressions are defined in MWE_PATTERNS.
